sentences.en: Concerned about is a kinship, a ray of Acacia, a blessing.
sentences.cn: 牵挂是一份亲情, 一缕相思, 一种幸福.

sentences.en: Even after meeting only once , they felt a kinship.
sentences.cn: 他们虽然只见了一面, 但已是一见如故了.

sentences.en: I feel a certain kinship with him.
I feel a strong kinship with him.
I felt a certain kinship to them.
sentences.cn: 突然,我对它们产生了一种同病相怜的亲密感.

sentences.en: Kidney transplantation with living donar from kinship ( Report of 3 case )
sentences.cn: 亲属活体肾移植 ( 附3例报告 )
血统组织占有很重要的地位.

sentences.en: Kinship is healing; we are physicians to each other.
sentences.cn: 我们彼此的骨肉亲情是抚慰疾苦的良医.

sentences.en: People tend to make sense of relationship by kinship.
sentences.cn: 隐喻是人类认知的工具,人类通过亲属关系隐喻来理解世界上的其他关系.

sentences.en: Perhaps the Beatific Vision itself has some remote kinship with this lowly experience.
sentences.cn: 或许至福幻象本身就同这种平凡的体验有着某种淡薄的血缘关系.

sentences.en: The ties of kinship may have helped the young man find his way in life.
sentences.cn: 亲情可能帮这个年轻人找到了生活的方向。

sentences.en: There a kinship between novels and Chinese tradition literature.
sentences.cn: 阿城小说的语言、技法与我国传统文学、小说具有明显的亲缘关系.

sentences.en: Therefore, our life and kinship are inseparable.
sentences.cn: 所以, 我们的一生都是和亲情分不开的.

sentences.en: Wicca is a joyous religion springing from our kinship with nature.
sentences.cn: 巫术崇拜是让我们回复与自然血缘关系的欢乐宗教.

words.tran_cn: 同类的；有亲属关系的；性质类似的
[法]亲属关系，家属关系；亲密关系

trans.tran_cn: 亲属关系，（因起源或态度相似而产生的）亲切感
